elements.title: Shchors (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Ukrainian composer Borys Lyatoshynsky (pictured) composed his second opera, Shchors, about a military hero from 1937 in keeping with the Soviet party line?

elements.title: Ronteza (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that although Ronteza slipped and fell chasing a cow in competition, she made Arabian horse history?

elements.title: Tammy Wynette (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tammy Wynette once toured on a bus labeled "Mr. and Mrs. Country Music" with her husband George Jones?

elements.title: Zork (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one scholar compared the importance of Zork to that of Homer's Iliad?

elements.title: Sydney Simmons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that philanthropist Sydney Simmons gave Friary Park a statue of Queen Victoria as Peace holding a dove, but the dove was replaced with a spear?

elements.title: Futures (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite Jimmy Eat World running out of song ideas in pre-production, Rolling Stone called Futures their "finest album"?

elements.title: Su Hanchen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Chinese court painter Su Hanchen is known for his paintings of children?

elements.title: Poland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite not ever visiting the country, Lil Yachty rapped about taking the wock to Poland?
